API Documentation¶

class old.controllers.tags.TagsController[source]¶

REST Controller styled on the Atom Publishing Protocol

create()[source]¶

POST /tags: Create a new tag.

delete(id)[source]¶

DELETE /tags/id: Delete an existing tag.

edit(id)[source]¶

GET /tags/id/edit: Return the data necessary to update an existing OLD tag; here we return only the tag and an empty JSON object.

index()[source]¶

GET /tags: Return all tags.

new()[source]¶

GET /tags/new: Return the data necessary to create a new OLD tag. NOTHING TO RETURN HERE ...

show(id)[source]¶

GET /tags/id: Return a JSON object representation of the tag with id=id.

If the id is invalid, the header will contain a 404 status int and a JSON object will be returned. If the id is unspecified, then Routes will put a 404 status int into the header and the default 404 JSON object defined in controllers/error.py will be returned.

update(id)[source]¶

PUT /tags/id: Update an existing tag.

old.controllers.tags.createNewTag(data)[source]¶

Create a new tag model object given a data dictionary provided by the user (as a JSON object).

old.controllers.tags.updateTag(tag, data)[source]¶

Update the input tag model object given a data dictionary provided by the user (as a JSON object). If CHANGED is not set to true in the course of attribute setting, then None is returned and no update occurs.
